intro: Centaurium umbellatum, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters. The plant features a slender stem with opposite, linear to lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and clustered in an umbel, usually in shades of pink to red. It blooms from June to August and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
